ResourceHeader.Description:
The Double Star 1 Hot Ion Analyzer (HIA)  is an ion energy-spectrometry experiment, capable of obtaining full three-dimensional ion distributions with good angular and time resolution (one spacecraft spin).

The HIA summary  parameter data set contains various parameters at 1 min  resolution. These parameters include universal time, the instrument status, the ion density, ion bulk velocity, and ion temperature.

AccessURL.Name: REGARDS
AccessURL.Description: Access via CNES Data Archive for CDPP

Parameter.Name: Double Star 1 HIA Status Summary Parameter
Parameter.Description: Double Star 1 HIA status at 60 s resolution.

Parameter.Name: Double Star 1 HIA Ion Density Summary Parameter
Parameter.Description: Double Star 1 HIA ion number density at 60 s resolution

Parameter.Name: Double Star 1 HIA Ion Bulk Velocity Summary Parameter
Parameter.Description: Double Star 1 HIA ion bulk velocity at 60 s resolution in GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Double Star 1 HIA Parallel Ion Temperature Summary Parameter
Parameter.Description: Double Star 1 HIA parallel ion temperature at 60 s

Parameter.Name: Double Star 1 HIA Perpendicular Ion Temperature Summary Parameter
Parameter.Description: Double Star 1 HIA perpendicular ion temperature at 60 s

Parameter.Name: Double Star 1 HIA Ion Temperature Summary Parameter
Parameter.Description: Double Star 1 HIA ion temperature at 60 s resolution
